__e: Why didn't you let me know you were coming home?
Anyway, she already gave me a notice. She's leaving next week.
Why didn't you warn me you were coming over?
Well why didn't you come to me at once?
Why didn't you warn me before it happened?
Thank god you told me before i put it in someone's drink.
But he advised her to keep away from that tree.
Somebody told him to pipe down.
Has this uncle of yours ever warned you never to speak to strangers?
That's right. I suppose you tipped him off about tomorrow night.
You warned them what would happen, remember?
He should be home by now.
My sister told me what to expect.
I just wanted to find out if you'd notified the board of directors.
Good for her that she let her know what's coming for her.
Would it be bad manners to ask who tipped off the police at the market?
Why didn't you warn my daughter?
Maybe he better first tell us why he didn't warn our folks.
